title: What happen to the other Keen artist?
content:
like...what ever happen to rocketjess art work?

I liked her work... that and i should get back into Keen art.

content:
I've never even heard of her! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

Got any link to her art?

And, yeah, I still remember your Keen art, great stuff. More! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: What happen to the other Keen artist?
content:
I think RocketJess moved on a while ago, we used to chat some, but she's not updated her accounts or sites, and she's not online anymore.

I'm sure there were other artists here. What about Flasoe? And the shadowlands series of his?

title: haha
content: Yeah, it was Flaose.  He lurked a bit on the Keen:Galaxy section of K:M before he left... I always wondered what kind of mods he would have made.

title: Re: haha
content:
Ah, forgive me. A pity to see Flaose is gone. I don't think I've ever heard of this Ilsoap at all, he a bit quiet? (Like a lot of people around here?)
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Ilsoap
content: Ilsoap made the Lego Keen mod, and the well-animated Shadowlands series... he's moved on out of the community because he's persuing a career in animation, and last I heard, he was doing art for ClubPenguin.com, which is a graphic chatroom for younger people.

title: Re: Ilsoap
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Yeah, it was Flaose. He lurked a bit on the Keen:Galaxy section of K:M before he left... I always wondered what kind of mods he would have made. [hr][/quote]

Didn't he say that he would never make a mod again?

....Anyway Flaose will always be Flasoe in my hart. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] -----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Ilsoap
content:
Don't forget Ilsoap's artwork in Rule of the Yorp's Supper Table. Hands down the best Keen fangame ever made, too bad it wasn't finished.


With that aside, yeah, Ilsoap is working for Club Penguin last I checke with him (Which granted was a few months).

I really liked his style better than anyone else's on PCKF. He was a great member of PCKF.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Ilsoap
content:
Well, it seems both of our most talented artists are currently AWOL. I remember playing Lego Keen, it was an incredible modification.

Club penguin sounds interesting, but I shan't have time to investigate it fully. Are there any Keen references snuck in?
